name: Projects and Programs
body:
## Independent Projects and Programs
#### CSA Line Tower Defense
CSA-LTD Unity Game | September 2015 - October 2015
+ Developed a simple game using the Unity engine to gain familiarity with the engine as well as with some of the algorithms being used in the Artificial Intelligence course
+ GitHub: <https://github.com/anthonyuitz/CSA-LTD/>

#### Google CodeU Mentorship Program
FridgExpert Android App | January 2015 - August 2015
+ Worked on a series of technical exercises focusing on data structures and algorithms under the mentorship of a Google engineer
+ Received professional and programming development guidance through workshops and a 3 day summit 
+ Completed Udacityâ€™s Developing Android Apps course with a three person team over the course of a month, culminating in the FridgExpert mobile app, which leveraged GraphAPI and content providers to monitor user food spending habits as well as food expiration, waste, and consumption
+ GitHub: <https://github.com/anthonyuitz/FoodApp/>

#### HackTJ Plander
Automatic Facebook Calendar | 2013
+ Utilized Facebook development tools with Heroku to make an application that pulled events from Facebook groups, creating a semi-automatically updated planner on a team of two

#### TJHSST League of Legends Website
TJLoL Website | 2010 - 2013
+ Created a website to connect the League of Legends gaming community at my high school
+ Used the website to organize tournaments, find other players, and act as a front for the club at my school
+ Grew to support a community of hundreds of local League of Legends gamers

#### TJHSST Neuroscience Research Lab Program
*Aplysia* Neuron Computational Model | Fall 2012
+ Constructed a realistic computational model of a cluster of *Aplysia* neurons using the NEURON software which was instrumental in proving the viability of a simulation development area in the Neuroscience Research Lab.

## Classwork
#### Game Design Final Project
Infinite Tower Java Game | March 2016 - May 2016
+ Expanded on a professor provided framework to develop a complete game engine with tweening, sound managing, physics, display object hierarchy, and more
+ Designed, prototyped, and developed a turn-based dungeon crawler with an infinite number of procedurally generated levels with a team of three
+ GitHub: <https://github.com/anthonyuitz/pixel2.0/>

#### Electronic Commerce Final Project
UVAStudyCollab Website | January 2015 - April 2015
+ Developed a website for students to establish study groups based on current class schedules using Django and Python with a three person team over the course of the semester
+ GitHub: <https://github.com/anthonyuitz/uvastudycollab/>

#### Advanced Software Development Final Project
Secure Witness Website | April 2015
+ Constructed a website for news reports and similar content that allowed users to search, encrypt, and download the reports of other members in three weeks with a four person team
+ GitHub: <https://github.com/jmh2bj/SecureWitness-s15-team14/>

#### Software Development Methods Final Project
GhostHunter Android Game | October 2013
+ Devised a mobile game that utilized device location to have players track down and destroy four ghosts after fulfilling storyline requirements
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
